intro: Rosa arvensis var. scandens, commonly known as the creeping red mallow, is a perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with stems that often root at the nodes, allowing it to spread across the ground. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer.
